meanings.definition: The act of moving in an orderly, formal way.
meanings.sent1: The processioning of the students into the auditorium was very organized.
meanings.sent2: We watched the processioning of the royal family during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The processioning of the ducks in a row made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The processioning of the ants carrying food back to their nest was like a tiny army on the move.
meanings.sent5: The processioning of the dancers in perfect sync left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: A line or group of people or vehicles moving in a formal way.
meanings.sent1: The processioning of cars in the funeral was solemn.
meanings.sent2: The processioning of the wedding party down the aisle was beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The processioning of the penguins at the zoo was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The processioning of the soldiers in uniform was a display of discipline.
meanings.sent5: The processioning of the choir singers brought harmony to the church.

meanings.definition: To move in a formal way, especially as part of a ceremony or ritual.
meanings.sent1: The students were processioning into the graduation hall.
meanings.sent2: The priests were processioning towards the temple for the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cats were processioning around the house in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were processioning down the street in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The knights were processioning into the castle for the knighting ceremony.
